issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Azure data lake does not support fs.defaultFS pointing to adls storage as of today.So documentation to point fs.defaultFS configuration is confusing to customer integrating adls configuration in there storage.
fields.summary: [Azure Data Lake] Correction needed in fs.defaultFS support in documentation

comments.body:
Removed 
{quote}
 <property>
      <name>fs.defaultFS</name>
      <value>YOUR ADL STORE URL (e.g., https://example.azuredatalakestore.net) </value>
    </property>
{quote}
section from the documentation.

This message was automatically generated.

+1

However, if configuring fs.defaultFS to point to ADLS is unsuppported, it might be worth noting that limitation in the documentation, also. I committed this fixup to trunk.

Thanks Vishwajeet

SUCCESS: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10135 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10135/])
HADOOP-13393. Omit unsupported fs.defaultFS setting in ADLS (cdouglas: rev dca6335dbc25c7c81444a294d68d821308eef69e)
* hadoop-tools/hadoop-azure-datalake/src/site/markdown/index.md

[~vishwajeet.dusane], thank you for the patch.  [~chris.douglas], thank you for reviewing.  I see the desired fix version is 3.0.0-alpha1.  We have a separate branch-3.0.0-alpha1 now, so I cherry-picked the trunk patch to there.
